newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: MUGABE MAN SECURES BIG HARARE MAYORAL POLL WIN.
newsitem.headline: MUGABE MAN SECURES BIG HARARE MAYORAL POLL WIN.

text.p: Zimbabwe's ruling ZANU-PF party surprised local political analysts on Monday by winning Harare's executive mayoral election by an unexpectedly high margin.

Its candidate Solomon Tawengwa polled 14,446 votes to independent rival Kempton Makamure's 4,182 votes in the weekend contest in which only 13.24 percent of registered voters took part, polling officials reported.

Many political analysts had predicted a close race between Tawengwa, a prominent Harare businessman, and University of Zimbabwe law lecturer Makamure, an outspoken government critic and democracy campaigner.
Both candidates were unavilable for immediate comment.
